features.name: Second Wind
features.description: You have a limited well of stamina that you can draw on to protect yourself from harm. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your fighter level.
features.usage: Once per short or long rest

features.name: Fighting Style
features.description: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. You canâ€™t take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

subFeatures.name: Fighting Style: Archery
subFeatures.description: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
conditions: You must be attacking with a ranged weapon

subFeatures.name: Fighting Style: Defense
subFeatures.description: While you are wearing armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC.

subFeatures.name: Fighting Style: Dueling
subFeatures.description: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
conditions: You must be wielding only one melee weapon in one hand

subFeatures.name: Fighting Style: Great Weapon Fighting
subFeatures.description: When you roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die for an attack you make with a melee weapon that you are wielding with two hands, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1 or a 2. The weapon must have the two-handed or versatile property for you to gain this benefit.
conditions: You must be wielding one melee weapon with two hands
The weapon must have the two-handed or versatility property
You must roll a 1 or 2 on a damage die

subFeatures.name: Fighting Style: Protection
subFeatures.description: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.
conditions: You must be wielding a shield
You can see the hostile attacking creature
The friendly creature being attacked is within 5 feet of you

subFeatures.name: Fighting Style: Two-Weapon Fighting
subFeatures.description: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
conditions: You must be wielding one weapon in each of two hands
